DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Best Overall RECIST Response Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The best overall disease response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment, using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECISTv1.1).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Lesion Best Overall Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The most clinically favorable response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)._Having the most positive qualities._Including everything._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 tt VD versioned for changes to max length and PVs per RECIST 1.1; transferred Context, added CSI and reg status per Round 5 finalization task.   6/3/14 added Non-CR/Non-PD value per CCR Round 5 community review comment; upd max length and release VD and CDE for DCP reuse. jc  8/20/13 created for RECIST CRF module based on RECISTv1.1 value definitions.
